intro: Erica globiceps subsp. consors, commonly known as the Cape heath or yellow heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and mountainous regions, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. It is well adapted to Mediterranean climates and is often found in coastal fynbos vegetation. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
